content:
I'm so sorry to hear about the loss of your grandmother. Losing a loved one is never easy, and it's understandable that it's still hard for you to come to terms with her passing.

Of course, I'd be happy to help you with some condolence message ideas for the funeral you'll be attending next week. Here are a few suggestions:

**General Condolence Messages**

1. "My heart goes out to you and your family during this difficult time. May [name] rest in peace."
2. "I'm so sorry for your loss. May cherished memories of [name] bring you comfort and peace."
3. "My thoughts and prayers are with you as you say goodbye to [name]. May they be at peace."
4. "Words can't express how sorry I am for your loss. [Name] will be deeply missed."
5. "May the love and support of family and friends help you through this difficult time."

**Personalized Condolence Messages**

1. "I'll always remember [name]'s [kindness, sense of humor, generosity, etc.]. They will be deeply missed."
2. "My favorite memory of [name] is [share a brief story or memory]. I'll carry that with me always."
3. "I'm so grateful to have known [name]. They made a significant impact on my life."
4. "I'll never forget [name]'s [advice, guidance, support, etc.]. They will always be with me in spirit."
5. "May [name]'s legacy live on through the love and memories we shared with them."

**Sympathy Messages for a Specific Relationship**

1. (To a friend who lost a parent) "I'm here for you, just like your [mom/dad] would want me to be. I'm so sorry for your loss."
2. (To a friend who lost a spouse) "My heart goes out to you and your family. May the love you shared with [name] continue to guide you through this difficult time."
3. (To a friend who lost a sibling) "I can only imagine how hard this must be for you. Please know I'm here to support you, just like [brother/sister] would want me to."

Remember, the most important thing is to be genuine and sincere in your condolence message. You can always add or modify these suggestions to fit your personal relationship with the person who has passed away and the family they left behind.

I hope these ideas help, and I wish you peace and comfort as you attend the funeral next week.
